intro: Justicia graciliflora, commonly known as slender-flowered justicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its rapid growth and ability to attract pollinators make it a valuable addition to native plant landscapes.
